perturbation.original_text: Integrity agrees to respond to any request for approval within five (5) business days after Integrity's receipt of request and samples.
perturbation.changed_text: Integrity agrees to respond to any request for approval within one (1) business day after Integrity's receipt of request and samples.
perturbation.explanation: Requiring a response within one business day may be unreasonably short, potentially violating implied duties of good faith and fair dealing under Tennessee law, which requires parties to act honestly and reasonably in the performance of their contractual obligations. This unreasonably short timeframe could be considered a breach of that duty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Tennessee law - implied duties of good faith and fair dealing in contract performance.

perturbation.original_text: Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least thirty (30) days written notice (and not more than once in respect of any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of two (2) years from the date on which any statement is rendered. Such auditing party must make specific written objection within such two (2) year period. Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same within two (2) years and six (6) months after the applicable statement is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party, at its sole expense, upon at least fifteen (15) days written notice (and not more than once in respect of any accounting period) will have the right to inspect the other party's books regarding the obligations hereunder for a period of one (1) year from the date on which any statement is rendered. Such auditing party must make specific written objection within such one (1) year period. Thereafter, it will be deemed to have consented to any such statements or accountings which will then be considered an account stated as between the parties, not subject to any objection for any reason whatsoever. Provided the objecting party has made timely written objection, as aforesaid, such party may file an action regarding same within one (1) year and six (6) months after the applicable statement is rendered, after which time any such action will be deemed barred.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the inspection period to one year and the objection period to one year and six months could be deemed unreasonably short under Tennessee law, potentially hindering a party's ability to discover and challenge accounting errors. Statute of limitations for breach of contract in Tennessee is six years, so the contract is shortening the time to file an action.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Tennessee Statute of Limitations for Breach of Contract (T.C.A. ยง 28-3-109)

perturbation.changed_text: In the event of such an Source: INTEGRITY MEDIA INC, 10-K405, 3/29/2001 assignment by either party of its rights to an unrelated third party, the other party shall be given written notice, then in such event the other party may upon thirty (30) days written notice terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination upon assignment to 30 days may be considered commercially unreasonable under Tennessee law. Tennessee courts generally uphold contracts unless they are unconscionable, but this short notice period could be argued as such, especially if the non-assigning party relies heavily on the agreement.
